page.title: 11Reverend J. Thorold.
page.content: Revered Thorold has been vicar of the Spilsby group of churches since l977. During this time he has seen a small rise in the size of his congregation due, he considers, to the introduction of the family service. Everybody is welcome to this family service and where possible members of the congregation take part by reading extracts from the bible and reading the prayers. The duties of a vicar are to baptise, marry and bury; to visit the sick and elderly and to train young people in the knowledge of God. He also has to prepare services for the worship of God on Sundays. Reverend Thorold is a much loved and respected member of the community and the sight of him pedalling his cycle around his parish is as familiar as the postman doing his round.
